page.description: The DEFINE CLASS ... END CLASS language elements create a new class. The class may DIM and assign values to variables. It may also include functions (methods).
page.syntax: DEFINE CLASS [ Scope ] class=Name statements END CLASS

argument.name: Scope
argument.description: Optional. Default = "LOCAL". "SHARED" = The class exists as long as a window is open. Even if you change the layout that is loaded in the window (by using the File > Open... command from within the Form or Browse window), the class continues to exist. "GLOBAL" = The class exists as long as Alpha Anywhere is running, until you close the current database.

argument.name: class=Name
argument.description: The name of the class to be created. Example:

page.example: DEFINE CLASS ClassName ' dim local variables ' assign values to variables ' define functions END CLASS
